intro: Vachellia oviedoensis, commonly known as the Oviedo acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of South America, particularly in Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow, spherical flower clusters. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions. The species is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
